medical_history.chief_complaint: Disabling hip pain associated with degenerative joint disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has had intermittent back pain and has experienced hip pain that is currently disabling. He reports that he could not exercise due to this hip pain, which began after he had lost weight and improved his physical activity over the past 2 years. He plans to have hip replacement surgery in the next few weeks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity for much of life, hypertension and hyperlipidemia for at least 20 years, diabetes diagnosed about 10 years ago, stroke in 1988, hospitalization for cellulitis of the foot in 1996, crescendo angina leading to CABG surgery in 1998, pulmonary embolism in 1998, severe erectile dysfunction for about 8 years.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of obesity, arteriosclerotic cardiovascular disease, and hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Former heavy tobacco user, stopped in 1982, now smokes occasional cigar. Drinks little or no alcohol, maximum of 2 beers daily. Sedentary lifestyle with little exercise until the past 2 years.
